What to do

Upload your photo for your Student ID

Upload your photo between 27 August to 10 September and your Student card will be ready for collection following your course induction event.

Important notice

If you do not upload your photo within the dates specified, you’ll need to visit the registry office from Monday 24 September for your student card.

   Upload your photo 

Induction sessions

Ensure you attend your induction sessions.

Documents

Important notice

Please contact the admissions team at Ulster University to complete your document checks.
You cannot enrol until your documents have been checked.

Bring along all essential documents.

  Find out more

NI, GB and EU Students

What to bring to your Admissions Check-in

You will require the following documentation:

  1. Photographic ID (e.g. Passport or Driving Licence)
  2. Documentary evidence (original copies and not photocopies) of all examinations taken from GCSE Level (or equivalent) onwards.

    If you do not have the original certificates, we will accept your Statement of Results or a letter signed and stamped by your School or College.

    If you do not bring evidence of qualifications to your admissions checks, a hold will be placed on your record. You will then be given 14 days to supply this evidence, after which your registration and student finance will be cancelled.

  3. If not already enrolled, you will need to bring payment for fees; or acceptable evidence that fees will be paid by an education authority or sponsor.

Normally if you are enrolling on a postgraduate course (with the exception of PGCE courses), you will only be required to produce evidence relating to your primary degree (unless otherwise specifically requested by the University).

International students

What to bring to your Admissions Check-in

You will require the following documentation:

  1. Passport
  2. Evidence of immigration status, i.e. 30-day visa vignette and Biometric Residence Permit (BRP) for Tier 4 students; BRP for other Points-Based System visas (e.g. Tier 2, Tier 5); visa vignette or entry stamp in passport for Short-term Student visas; letter from Home Office (for students who have ongoing visa applications with the Home Office); ARC for asylum seekers
    Original copy of English language certificate/qualification that was used to make the offer of a place of study at Ulster.
  3. For Tier 4 students studying at sub-degree level (including Pre-sessional students) this will be a SELT (Secure English Language Test, usually a UKVI IELTS) and will be listed on the CAS.
    For all other Tier 4 students, the certificate will not be listed on the CAS (the CAS will simply state that the student’s English was assessed by the University) but will be stored in the Banner Document Repository or the UCAS student folder.
  4. Original copy of academic document/s that were used to make the offer of a place of study at Ulster.
    For Tier 4 students, these will be confirmed in the “documents used to make offer” section of the CAS.
  5. ATAS Certificate (if applicable)

Free Software

As an Ulster University student, you can download the latest version of the Microsoft Office suite free of charge. You can do this once registered. You can also ensure your computer is protected against viruses and threats with McAfee Anti-virus software.

Medical registrations

Ulster University strongly advises all our students to register with a local doctor (GP) & have the relevant travel/ medical insurance.

  Find your nearest doctor (GP)

Meningitis Vaccine

Ensure you have your Men ACWY vaccine before coming to uni. As a fresher you are in a high risk group, particularly in the first few weeks of term.
